clinical_study.brief_title: Gonadal Hormone, Gonadotropin and Cardiovascular Events
clinical_study.official_title: Association Between Serum Gonadal Hormone, Gonadotropin and Cardiovascular Events

brief_summary.textblock: Deficiency in gonadal hormone has been considered to play a role in ageing related increased incidence of cardiovascular events. But the mechanism has not been fully elucidated. On the other hand, the dramatic increase in gonadotropin level didn't drew much attention when talking about the increased risk of cardiovascular disease during menopausal transition. This study aim to investigate the association between gonadal hormone, gonadotropin and long-term cardiovascular events.

arm_group.description: Women with regular menstrual cycles in normal range (22-35 days) for the previous three cycles.

Women with variability in menstrual cycle length, defined as a persistent difference of 7 days or more in the length of consecutive cycles, or amenorrhea of at least 60 days but no longer than 12 months.
Women with amenorrhea of at least 12 consecutive months.

study_pop.textblock: Adults aged of 18 to 75 years old. Part of the subjects (aged 40 years or more) were selected from REACTION study that was conducted from April,1, 2011 through May 30, 2012, aiming to investigate the epidemiology of metabolic diseases across China. The younger participants were recruited since July 1, 2014.
